result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:28 a.m.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Dylan J Worden on cases 20CF247 and 20CF334.  Defendant Dylan J Worden IS NOT in court.   Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney William Weiland in court for Dylan J Worden on cases 21CF61, 21CF106, 21CF116, 21CF132, 21CF285, 21CF417, 22CF154, 22CF158, 22CF161, 22CF162, 22CF165 and 22CM112.  Defendant Dylan J Worden IS NOT in court.   Assistant District  Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Cases heard today are 20CF247, 20CF334, 21CF61, 21CF106, 21CF116, 21CF132, 21CF285, 21CF417, 22CF154, 22CF158, 22CF161, 22CF162, 22CF165 and 22CM112.

Court questions Atty Gardner with regards to the cases he represents the defendant on.
Atty Weiland clarifies the cases that he represents the defendant on.
Court questions the non-appearance.
Court questions ADA Dodge as to why the defendant is not appearing at today's hearing and if he needs to appear.
Atty Gardner will waive his clients appearance for today's hearing.
Atty Gardner would ask that 20CF247 be scheduled for trial.
Atty Gardner has not yet set this for a speedy trial demand (he has not yet filed) and would ask that this be set within the next 90 days.
Atty Gardner would ask for a scheduling order.
Parties are still working to resolve these cases.

Atty Weiland joins in Atty Gardners responses.
Atty Weiland agrees that 20CF247 should be set for trial first.
ADA Dodge is in agreement with this request for trial on 20CF247.
Court informs Atty Gardner that if he wants a speedy trial that he will need to file the speedy trial demand as there is no time slot available within the next 90 days for
a trial.
Court questions ADA Dodge with regards to the # of day's needed and he states that 3 days should be sufficient.
Parties are now agreeing to 2 days for the trial.
Court questions the parties if the plan on filing any substantive motions.
ADA Dodge not anticipate this.
Atty Gardner does anticipate filing a motion to suppress.
Atty Gardner agrees with hearing this on 11/23/22 
Court questions if all discovery has been sent out 
Court questions Atty Weiland with regards to the next case 20CF334 and Atty Gardner is the attorney of record.
With regards to 20CF334 - 2 day jury trial for this case.
If the parties settle 20CF247 then 20CF334 will then be heard on the dates below.
20CF247 will be in the first position and 20CF334 will be in the second position.
Atty Weiland states that if the 20CF247 and 20CF334 settle then his cases will fall into position and be settled.
Court would like to get some dates on the calendar though - just in case they don't settle.
21CF61 and 20CF334 have the same victim. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
ADA Dodge states that there are no victims present in the courtroom today.

BY THE COURT:
20CF247 1st position & 20CF334 second position:
Jury Trial - 12/14/22 & 12/15/22 
Final Pretrial - 11/23/22 @ 11-11:30 a.m.
Substantive Motion Hearing - 11/11/22 @ 11 a.m.
Motions in Limine, Substantive Motions, Witness List and Jury Instructions to be filed by 10/28/22 
All discovery to provided to each party no later than 09/30/22
ADA Dodge to file a letter with the court to inform the court that all discovery has been provided to defense

21CF61 will be in the third position:
Jury Trial - same date as above

PTC to be set for all cases 08/22/22 at 11 a.m.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification filed by Atty William Weiland (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 08/03/22 sp)

Court orders $7,500 cash bond with conditions previously stated, in the remaining 13 bonds. (all but for 22CF-234 and 20CF-247)

($7,500 cash bond covers all theses cases: 2021CF000106, 2021CF000116, 2021CF000132, 2021CF000285, 2021CF000417, 2022CF000154, 2022CF000158, 2022CF000161, 2022CF000162, 2022CF000165, 2022CM000112, and 21CF61.).

Defendant Dylan J Worden in court, in custody.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Dylan J Worden.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case heard at this time is 22CF-234.
In addition 20CF-334, 21CF-61, 21CF-106, 21CF-116, 21CF-132, 21CF-285, 21CF-417, 22CF-154, 22CF-158, 22CF-161, 22CF-162, 22CF-165 and 22CM-112 are called.

3:07 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances. 

There are a couple motions in 22CF-234, that will be addressed at this time.
In 20CF-247, Atty Robert Gardner represents Defendant, was previously privately retained.

BY THE COURT:
Court will then not call 20CF-247, for Atty Gardner is not present today.

Court reviews the motions. 
State has not filed any response.

Atty Weiland addresses the Court.
Motion to request the Court to reconsider finding probable cause is addressed first.
Atty Weiland argues for the motion at this time, requests the Court to dismiss this case.
Court reviews the transcript from the preliminary hearing.
Atty Dodge replies, requests the Court to bind over for trial.
Atty Weiland replies.

Court addresses the parties. 

BY THE COURT:
Court reverses itself.
Court grants motion to reconsider and will not bind over in 22CF-234. This is essentially a dismissal.

Court will leave it up to the State how to wish to pursue this.
State intends to refile the charges.

State moves to dismiss 22CF-234.

BY THE COURT:
22CF-234 is dismissed.

Motion to address bond is next.
Court wants to address bond in all the remaining files.

Atty Weiland addresses the Court regarding bond modification in all remaining files referred to. 
State requests that the $7,500 cash bond in 22CF-234 continue but be put in one of the other open cases. 

BY THE COURT:
Court orders $7,500 cash bond with conditions previously stated, in the remaining 13 bonds. (all but for 22CF-234 and 20CF-247)

($7,500 cash bond covers all 13 bonds).

BY THE COURT:
Scheduling conference to bet set for August 8th at 10 am, for the 14 cases.  Trials will be set.
This matter is set for a PTC on 08/08/2022 at 10:00 a.m. - Parties are working on a resolution.
